definition: needlework/sewing
needle/pin/injection/stitch/CL:根[gen1],支[zhi1]
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
to live/alive/living/work/workmanship
needlework/working for a living as a needleworker
needlework/sewing

sentences.english: When she sews she makes long stitches.
sentences.chinese: 她做針線活時針腳很大。

sentences.english: You know, the ancient Chinese women were supposed to be good at needlework.
sentences.chinese: 知道嗎，中國古代女子都得做針線活。

sentences.english: She just did needlework and made tea.
sentences.chinese: 她只是做針線活和泡茶。

sentences.english: The lonely patient derives pleasure from sewing.
sentences.chinese: 那個孤獨的病人從針線活兒裏獲得樂趣。

sentences.english: I used to hate sewing before we got a sewing machine.
sentences.chinese: 在我們買來縫紉機之前我最恨做針線活。

sentences.english: I hate having to fetch out the sewing machine every time I want to do some sewing.
sentences.chinese: 每當我想做點針線活時就得把縫紉機搬出來，真討厭。
做針線活兒，她可是把好手。

sentences.english: She feel very awkward with a needle.
sentences.chinese: 她做針線活時感到很不對勁。

sentences.english: When she sewed she made long stitches.
sentences.chinese: 當她幹針線活時，她的針腳總是弄的很長。

sentences.english: She is an excellent housemaid, and works very well at her needle.
sentences.chinese: 她是個出色的女傭人，擅長做針線活。

sentences.english: They were chattering (discursively on a variety of topics) over their needlework.
sentences.chinese: 她們一邊做針線活一邊閒扯個不停。

sentences.english: Please carry on with your sewing. I'll tell you a story.
sentences.chinese: 繼續做針線活兒，我給你講個故事。

sentences.english: They are chattering over their needlework.
sentences.chinese: 她們一邊做針線活一邊嘮叨個不停。

sentences.english: All the stiching has been done by hand.
sentences.chinese: 所有的針線活多是手工完成的。

definition: variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
a short time/a little while
to whisper to one another's ear
to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
grand dreams/unrealistic ideas (idiom)
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
hum/drone/buzz
female gossip/busybody
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
to boast
foolish talk/nonsense
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
